dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, when you think about medical breakthroughs, what's, like, one of the first things that comes to mind?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, when you think about medical breakthroughs, what's, like, one of the first things that comes to mind?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, um, easily antibiotics, right? I mean, they were just, like, this miracle discovery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, um, easily antibiotics, right? I mean, they were just, like, this miracle discovery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Saved billions of lives, literally doubled life expectancy in, what, a hundred years? But then, uh, something went wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Saved billions of lives, literally doubled life expectancy in, what, a hundred years? But then, uh, something went wrong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The development of antimicrobial medications is undoubtedly one of humankinds most incredible achievements, saving billions of lives in the roughly 100 years since they were first discovered. This single discovery has nearly doubled peoples life expectancy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, super fast, actually. Less than two decades after penicillin, we started seeing antimicrobial resistance, or AMR. And it's now, like, a massive public health threat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, super fast, actually. Less than two decades after penicillin, we started seeing antimicrobial resistance, or A M R. And it's now, like, a massive public health threat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet less than 20 years after penicillin was discovered, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) was first detected. Since then, resistance has continued to grow into a major public health threat, causing an estimated 1 million deaths per year, and contributing to millions more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A massive threat. We're talking estimates of 1.3 million deaths a year now, directly from AMR. It's just devastating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A massive threat. We're talking estimates of one point three million deaths a year now, directly from A M R. It's just devastating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He highlighted the devastating toll of AMR, which currently claims 1.3 million lives annually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the UN General Assembly actually just recognized it as one of the world's most urgent health threats.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the U N General Assembly actually just recognized it as one of the world's most urgent health threats.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indicating the seriousness of the AMR threat, the United Nations General Assembly recently recognized it as one of the worlds most urgent health threats and demanded immediate action to safeguard the ability to treat diseases and enhance food security.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is why it's so important that Saudi Arabia is hosting this big ministerial conference right now in Jeddah, supporting the WHO's "One Health" program.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why it's so important that Saudi Arabia is hosting this big ministerial conference right now in Jeddah, supporting the W H O's One Health program.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats why the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is announcing a series of initiatives that support the World Health Organizations (WHOs) One Health program during the Fourth High-Level Global Ministerial Conference on AMR, which it is currently hosting in Jeddah.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [agrees] Yeah, "One Health" is interesting because it's not just about human medicine, is it? It's integrated across human, animal, agriculture, and even the environment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, One Health is interesting because it's not just about human medicine, is it? It's integrated across human, animal, agriculture, and even the environment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is designed to drive actions in human health, animal health, agriculture and the environment to ensure that lifesaving antimicrobials continue to be available, while protecting against deadly resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Trying to keep these life-saving drugs available, but also protect against that deadly resistance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Trying to keep these life-saving drugs available, but also protect against that deadly resistance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is designed to drive actions in human health, animal health, agriculture and the environment to ensure that lifesaving antimicrobials continue to be available, while protecting against deadly resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And from this conference, they've got this Jeddah Declaration. Pretty cool, like, a global scientific panel, a "Biotech Bridge" for research...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And from this conference, they've got this Jeddah Declaration. Pretty cool, like, a global scientific panel, a Biotech Bridge for research...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically at this meeting, the agreed Jeddah Declaration titled, From Declaration to Implementation translates each countrys commitments into actions, which include: The establishment of a global scientific panel to study and fight AMR The creation of a Biotech Bridge that supports AMR-related research, development and innovation, and The development of a learning hub to boost community awareness of antimicrobial resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and a learning hub for community awareness. Dr. Tedros from the WHO, he even compared AMR's impact to climate change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and a learning hub for community awareness. Doctor Tedros from the W H O, he even compared A M R's impact to climate change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The development of a learning hub to boost community awareness of antimicrobial resistance. World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has compared antimicrobial resistance (AMR) to climate change in terms of its critical impact on global health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's, uh, that's a really stark comparison, isn't it? And they're setting some ambitious targets, like a 10% reduction in deaths by 2030.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's, uh, that's a really stark comparison, isn't it? And they're setting some ambitious targets, like a ten percent reduction in deaths by twenty thirty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The UN General Assembly's Political Declaration on AMR has set ambitious targets, including a 10% reduction in deaths from bacterial AMR by 2030, marking a significant step in the global fight against this growing threat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Big goal. He also pointed out that cutting antibiotic use in animals by 30% could boost global GDP by $14 billion by 2050.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Big goal. He also pointed out that cutting antibiotic use in animals by thirty percent could boost global G D P by fourteen billion dollars by twenty fifty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, he pointed out that reducing antimicrobial use in animals by 30% could potentially increase global GDP by US$14 billion by 2050.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] That's fascinating, tying it to the economics. I mean, it really highlights the multi-faceted nature of the problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's fascinating, tying it to the economics. I mean, it really highlights the multi-faceted nature of the problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And Dr. Hanan Balkhy from WHO really praised Saudi Arabia for their leadership on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And Doctor Hanan Balkhy from W H O really praised Saudi Arabia for their leadership on this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dr. Hanan Balkhy, WHO Regional Director for the Eastern Mediterranean, praised Saudi Arabias role as host of the Fourth AMR Ministerial Conference, and for its leadership initiatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really sounds like strong international collaboration is absolutely essential here, you know? To slow it down and, hopefully, stop it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really sounds like strong international collaboration is absolutely essential here, you know? To slow it down and, hopefully, stop it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The WHO chief stressed that strong international collaboration is essential to protect these vital medicines and combat the rising challenge of AMR effectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Agreed. It's a huge challenge, but it's good to see, uh, so many countries committing to action.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Agreed. It's a huge challenge, but it's good to see, uh, so many countries committing to action.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 2024 AMR conference features the largest number of participating countries in the history of this bi-annual meeting. As a group, attending countries are demonstrating their commitment to: Doing a better job of preventing and controlling infections

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. Definitely something we need to keep an eye on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. Definitely something we need to keep an eye on.
